description:
Happy New Year Ladies!
The 2017 Sisters of OU Learning, Living, Loving, Leading (S.O.U.L.) Conference Planning Committee, would like to invite each of you to attend the 2017 S.O.U.L. Conference on the University of Oklahoma Norman Campus. THE CONFERENCE DATE IS FEBRUARY 4, 2017, from 9 AM – 5:00 PM, and will be held in the Oklahoma Memorial Union’s Meacham Auditorium. This year’s theme is “Stay S.O.U.L.-FULL!”. It is meant to foster remembrance for “our” heritage of warm & fuzzy after having had our fill of family, food, fun, and fellowship. We are hopeful that the timing will allow you to take part in what continues to be a milestone event for the University of Oklahoma. It is specifically tailored for our female students, faculty, staff, and OU alumni who self-identify as African and/or African-American as a part of their ancestral/ethnic background. The conference was conceived from the recognition that our Black women, particularly our students on all campuses, need increased support and opportunities to establish relationships with each other, faculty, staff, and alumni as they persist towards the completion of their college degrees.
keywords: SOUL, Black Women, African Women, African American Women
